meanings.sent1: The old wallpaper in the kitchen is delaminating, revealing the layers underneath.
meanings.sent2: The painter carefully removed the tape, delaminating the paint from the wall.
meanings.sent3: As the cake cooled, it started delaminating like a flaky pastry.
meanings.sent4: The ice on the pond was delaminating, creating a beautiful pattern of layers.
meanings.sent5: The scientist used a special technique to delaminate the sample for analysis.

meanings.definition: Peel or flake off in layers
meanings.sent1: The sunburned skin began delaminating, causing discomfort.
meanings.sent2: The old paint on the door was delaminating, revealing the wood underneath.
meanings.sent3: The sticker on the window started delaminating, making it look messy.
meanings.sent4: The bark of the tree was delaminating, exposing the inner layers.
meanings.sent5: The nail polish on her nails was delaminating, so she decided to remove it.

meanings.sent1: The excessive heat can delaminate the layers of the pavement.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind delaminated the posters on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally delaminated the pastry while trying to cut it.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake delaminated the rock formations, revealing their structure.
meanings.sent5: The chemicals used in the experiment delaminated the composite material.
